intro: Blepharis serrulata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved blepharis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like foliage and delicate, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sandy or rocky habitats and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers, which are usually pink or purple, bloom in summer and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Blepharis serrulata is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
